org.glassfish.tyrus.spi

Interface ClientEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TyrusClientEngine

    public interface ClientEngine
    Facade for handling client operations from containers.
    Author:
    Pavel Bucek (pavel.bucek at oracle.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ClientEngine.TimeoutHandler
      Indicates to container that handshake timeout was reached.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      UpgradeRequest createUpgradeRequest(URI uri, ClientEngine.TimeoutHandler timeoutHandler)
      Create upgrade request and register ClientEngine.TimeoutHandler.
      Connection processResponse(UpgradeResponse upgradeResponse, Writer writer, Connection.CloseListener closeListener)
      Process handshake response.

    • Method Detail

      • createUpgradeRequest

        UpgradeRequest createUpgradeRequest(URI uri,
                                  ClientEngine.TimeoutHandler timeoutHandler)
        Create upgrade request and register ClientEngine.TimeoutHandler.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of remote endpoint.
        timeoutHandler - handshake timeout handler. ClientEngine.TimeoutHandler.handleTimeout() is invoked if processResponse(UpgradeResponse, Writer, org.glassfish.tyrus.spi.Connection.CloseListener) is not called within handshake timeout.
        Returns:
        request to be send on the wire.

      • processResponse

        Connection processResponse(UpgradeResponse upgradeResponse,
                         Writer writer,
                         Connection.CloseListener closeListener)
        Process handshake response.
        Parameters:
        upgradeResponse - response to be processed.
        writer - used for sending dataframes from client endpoint.
        closeListener - will be called when connection is closed, will be set as listener of returned Connection.
        Returns:
        Tyrus connection representation. Handles all incoming data.
        See Also:
        Connection.getReadHandler(), ReadHandler
